intro: Nothoruellia, commonly known as the false senna, is a genus of flowering plants in the legume family, Fabaceae. It consists of several species native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plants are characterized by their compound leaves and showy yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. Nothoruellia species typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often found in moist, shaded environments. They play a role in ecological systems by fixing nitrogen and providing habitat for various insects and animals.
